error.signature: Deprecated: Function utf8_encode() is deprecated in /var/www/app/src/Utils/Encoder.php on line 42

verdict.summary: PHP deprecation notices indicate functions slated for removal in future versions. In PHP 8.2+, functions like utf8_encode/utf8_decode, and dynamic properties are deprecated. These must be replaced with modern alternatives before upgrading to the next major version.

dead_ends.why_fails: Hiding deprecation warnings allows code to continue using functions that will be removed in future PHP versions. When upgrading PHP, these will become fatal errors with no prior warning.

dead_ends.action: Using the @ error suppression operator on deprecated function calls
dead_ends.why_fails: The @ operator silences the notice but does not prevent the function from being removed. It also masks other potential errors at the same call site.

workarounds.action: Replace deprecated functions with their modern equivalents
workarounds.how: Replace utf8_encode() with mb_convert_encoding($s, 'UTF-8', 'ISO-8859-1'), replace utf8_decode() with mb_convert_encoding($s, 'ISO-8859-1', 'UTF-8'). Use Rector (rector/rector) to automate migrations across the entire codebase.

workarounds.action: Run PHP_CodeSniffer or Rector to detect and fix all deprecations automatically
workarounds.how: Install Rector: composer require rector/rector --dev. Configure it with the appropriate PHP version set (e.g., PHP_83) and run 'vendor/bin/rector process src' to automatically refactor deprecated code.

leads_to.condition: when upgrading to a PHP version that has removed the deprecated function

preceded_by.condition: when a library update introduces calls to functions deprecated in the current PHP version

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Deprecated functions still work but emit a notice; undefined functions cause a fatal error because the function has been fully removed
